meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impracticable.
meanings.sent1: The impracticabilities of climbing Mount Everest are well-known.
meanings.sent2: She faced many impracticabilities when trying to finish the impossible task.
meanings.sent3: The team's attempt to build a spaceship out of cardboard highlighted the impracticabilities of their plan.
meanings.sent4: His dream of flying without wings crashed into the harsh reality of impracticabilities.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun game to demonstrate the concept of impracticabilities to the students.

meanings.sent1: The room was cluttered with various impracticabilities that needed to be removed.
meanings.sent2: She sorted through the pile of impracticabilities to find something useful.
meanings.sent3: The box of broken toys was a collection of impracticabilities waiting to be fixed.
meanings.sent4: His garage was a graveyard of impracticabilities that he couldn't bear to part with.
meanings.sent5: The attic was filled with forgotten impracticabilities from years past.
